page.title: 13 A FARM IN CHURCH FENTON
page.content: {Church End Farm}is an{arable farm } of 250 acres. The soil varies,near the village it's sandy, further south is clay. Crops grown are wheat,barley,oats, potatoes and peas. Potatoes are sold in bulk and peas are sold to Kings Lynn. To drain each acre costs Â£750 and pot or plastic pipes are available. Both will silt up in time. Now the only animals on the farm are pets but he hopes to buy beef cattle. Machines are combine harvester, tractor,plough and potato sorter. Two men help Mr Boddy,his future plans are to knock down farm buildings and build bigger ones for cattle. His only problem is lack of water and the water authority won't let him install an underground water system.
